results.title: Best of British: Land Rover
results.creator_credit: Synchro Sports Television and Bruce Cox
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Best of British”.
This documentary traces the history of the Land Rover through prototypes and production models. The program travels to the locations where Land Rover made its name as a rugged off-road vehicle such as the Andes of South America and the jungles of Belize, and visits the largest Land Rover rally in the world.

results.title: Best of British: Jaguar
results.creator_credit: Synchro Sports Television and Bruce Cox
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Best of British”.
An early Jaguar advertising slogan summed up the timeless appeal of this great British marque as ‘grace, space and pace’. This documentary explores these legendary qualities by taking a close look at all the significant Jaguar models, from the pre-war coach-built ‘special saloons’ through the SS100 and XK120, the E-type and XJ models, up to Britain’s first ‘supercar’- the XJ220. Interviews with Jaguar drivers such as Stirling Moss and Jack Fairman, and archival footage contribute to a fascinating review of Jaguar’s unique place in British motoring history.

results.title: Best of British: Bentley
results.creator_credit: Synchro Sports Television and Bruce Cox
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Best of British”.
In the twenties Bentley sports cars built up an enviable reputation for speed and reliability, with wins at Brooklands and record-breaking success at Le Mans. More than 75 years after its conception in 1919 Bentley’s original reputation for quality engineering and ‘luxury with sporting character’ is still intact. Using extensive archival footage, the program documents the early designs of W.O Bentley, the Bower Bentley’s and the Bentley 6. Also featured are interviews with Bentley collectors and a liberally illustrated history of the Bentley’s racing career.

results.title: Best of British: Aston Martin
results.creator_credit: Synchro Sports Television and Bruce Cox
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Best of British”.
The full story of Aston Martin begins in 1913 and continues through an uninterrupted pedigree of classic cars to the sleek DB7 and awesome V8 Vantage of today. This documentary examines in detail all the significant Aston Martin models from the past eighty years including the Brooklands racers from the 1920’s, the rare 1940 Atom, the ‘David Brown’ sports cars, the V8 models and the latest DB7 ‘supercharged sixes’.

results.brief_description: This 8 part series looks at some of the classic cars that have been produced in Great Britain, and have brought years of driving pleasure to fine automobile enthusiasts.

results.title: Best laid plans
results.creator_credit: Tasmania. Dept. of Film Production, Don Anderson and John Edwards
results.brief_description: Two boys, one a diabetic, are overdue after a bushwalk. Basic bush search techniques are described in detail as rescue workers hunt for the boys.

results.title: Best in show
results.creator_credit: Castle Rock Entertainment, Karen Murphy and Christopher Guest
results.brief_description: Director Christopher Guest and cast members from his previous film ‘Waiting for Guffman’ reunite in this mockumentary following the exploits of five dogs and their handlers before the Mayflower Kennel Club Dog Show. Guest himself plays Harlan Pepper, a fly-fishing store owner and amateur ventriloquist, who decides to enter his beloved bloodhound Hubert in the prestigious competition. His competition includes “Winky”, a Norwich terrier, owned by neurotic couple Gerry and Cookie Fleck (Eugene Levy and Catherine O’Hara) and “Beatrice” a high-strung Wiemaraner owned by preppy couple Meg and Hamilton Swan (Parker Posey and Michael Hitchcock). Also making the trip to Philadelphia are Scott (John Michael Higgins) and Stefan (Michael McKean), life-partners from New York and their beloved Shih Tzu “Miss Agnes”, and trophy wife Sheri Ann Cabot (Jennifer Coolidge) and her friend and dog trainer, Christy Cummings (Jane Lynch) and their poodle, two time ‘Mayflower Best in Show’ winner, “Rhapsody in White”, also known as Butch. Cast also includes Fred Willard, Bob Balaban, Ed Begley Jr and Lewis Arquette.

results.title: Best horse
results.creator_credit: Learning Corporation of America, Nancy Gregory and Stephen Gyllenhaal
results.brief_description: Wendy Herstead, an eager teenager, is sure her beautiful sorrel horse Kick would win the Barrel Race event in the August rodeo, but her mother refuses to allow Wendy to enter. Wendy desperately schemes to raise the money for the entry fees and refuses to believe that Kick really isn’t a good barrel horse. Both mother and daughter learn important lessons about forcing people and animals into undesired roles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Learning Corporation of America, Nancy Gregory and Stephen Gyllenhaal
